            Hi there
            I’m Julia; I also go by Julie.
            I’m a marine ecologist and founded Openscapes to champion kinder, better science in less time. My main focus is how open source, data science, and environmental research can empower us to uncover climate solutions faster by working together as inclusive teams and communities. I am an active part of the open science movement.
            I am Co-Director of Openscapes and a Senior Fellow at National Center for Ecological Analysis & Synthesis (NCEAS) at the University of California Santa Barbara (UCSB).
            
            
            
            Experience
            2018-present: Founder & Co-Director, Openscapes. Senior Fellow, NCEAS, UCSB
            2018-2019: Mozilla Fellow
            2013-2019: Ocean Health Index science program lead, NCEAS, UCSB
            2012: PhD, Stanford University: Drivers and impacts of Humboldt squid in a changing climate

articles.contents:
Contents
Openscapes
Teaching
Ocean Health Index
Open communities

Openscapes
Openscapes is an approach for kinder, better science in less time. We approach open science as a spectrum, as a behavior change, and as a movement, and blog at openscapes.org/blog.
Openscapes Champions Program is an open data science mentorship program for science teams
NASA Openscapes Framework supports scientists using data from NASA Earthdata served from the Distributed Active Archive Centers (DAACs) as they migrate workflows to the cloud
Teaching
R for Excel Users by Lowndes & Horst is for Excel users who want to add or integrate R and RStudio into their existing data analysis toolkit. Originally taught at the 2020 RStudio Conference, it is a friendly intro to becoming a modern R user, full of tidyverse, RMarkdown, GitHub, collaboration & reproducibility and written to be used as a reference, to teach, or as self-paced learning.
Tidy Data Illustrated Series by Horst & Lowndes is artwork to illustrate why tidy data is so powerful for efficiency, reproducibility, and collaboration.
Ocean Health Index
The Ocean Health Index is a scientific framework used to measure how healthy oceans are. I was an OHI science program lead from 2013-2019 and helped amplify our transformation to open data science.
Our path to better science in less time using open data science tools by Lowndes et al. 2017 describes how our open data science tranformed our team’s approach to reproduciblity, collaboration, and communication.
OHI Global Assessments are updated annually since 2012 with the best available data and knowledge.
Open communities
I have built so much confidence from inclusive and welcoming open communities, who have been instrumental in my growth as an open science contributor.

Talks
Better Science for Future Us — July 12, 2021: Plenary at the inaugural Society for Open, Reliable, and Transparent Ecology and Evolutionary Biology SORTEE conference (30 minutes) (video)
Open science as a movement and the art of Openscapes — June 5, 2021: Keynote with Dr. Allison Horst at CascadiaR Conference (20 minutes)
How to empower researchers with open science through meeting analytical needs and supporting people - November 5, 2020. National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine (NASEM) Roundtable on Aligning Incentives for Open Science (published slides)
Entryways to open data science and the power of welcome - July 16, 2020: Plenary at Earth Science Information Partners Conference, Remote (15 mins) (Figshare) (video, starts ~ 2:55)
R for better science in less time - July 10, 2019: Opening Keynote, useR Conference, Toulouse, France (45 minutes) (video, starts ~46:30)
Publications
Open software means kinder science. Lowndes 2019, Scientific American.
Supercharge your research: a ten-week plan for open data science. Lowndes et al. 2019, Nature.
Our path to better science in less time using open data science tools. Lowndes et al. 2017, Nature Ecology & Evolution.
Nature article by Jeffrey Perkel: My digital toolbox: Julia Stewart Lowndes

Best practices for assessing ocean health in multiple contexts using tailorable frameworks. Lowndes et al. 2015, PeerJ.
Combined climate- and prey-mediated range expansion of Humboldt squid (Dosidicus gigas), a large marine predator in the California Current System. Stewart et al. 2014, Global Change Biology.
Behavioral ecology of Jumbo squid (Dosidicus gigas): in relation to oxygen minimum zones. Stewart et al. 2013, Deep Sea Research II.
